meanings.definition: To consult together; compare opinions; carry on a discussion or deliberation.
meanings.sent1: We will confer with our team before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: Let's confer with each other to see if we agree.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to confer about their project during lunch.
meanings.sent4: The birds confer in the trees, deciding where to build their nests.
meanings.sent5: The wise elders confer under the ancient oak tree to share their knowledge.

meanings.definition: To bestow upon as a gift, favor, honor, etc.
meanings.sent1: The king will confer knighthood upon the brave knight.
meanings.sent2: She decided to confer a special award to the top student.
meanings.sent3: The magician will confer magical powers upon the chosen one.
meanings.sent4: The fairy godmother conferred a beautiful dress to Cinderella.
meanings.sent5: The queen will confer a royal title to the loyal servant.

meanings.definition: To hold a conference or meeting.
meanings.sent1: The company will confer with its partners next week.
meanings.sent2: Let's confer in the boardroom to discuss the new project.
meanings.sent3: The animals decided to confer in the forest to address the issue.
meanings.sent4: The clouds confer in the sky, preparing for a storm.
meanings.sent5: The planets confer in the galaxy, aligning for a cosmic event.
